dismissalText.commentary: Noor Ali Zadran c Mutumbami b Chibhabha 63 (82b 8x4 0x6) SR: 76.82

dismissalComment.html: gone! Big wicket, the set man has to go. Just a full delivery outside off, Zadran looks to steer to third man but the ball skids on and takes a feather through to the keeper. Zadran looked really good in his innings but has to go now.

headshotImage.caption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Nabi c Jongwe b Muzarabani 17 (18b 2x4 1x6) SR: 94.44

dismissalComment.html: short and wide, and taken! Against the run of play. Stunning catch from the third man fielder. Not a delivery you want to be getting out to, but Nabi played under the ball a touch and the ball bounced and took a thick outside edge which flew all the way to third man who dived and hung on to a sharp chance. Well done from Jongwe.

gone! Another wild hoick and another wicket. Nice flight on middle, Mangal goes for a swipe over midwicket and against the turn, the ball turns a touch and takes the top edge which lobs up and straight to cover who takes an easy catch.

gone! The googly this time and Najibullah goes now, very poor delivery, pulls it short down leg but the googly generates some extra bounce and Najibullah goes back to pull but the bounce does for him, climbs sharply and takes the upper half of the bat. The ball spoons up for Ervine at short fine leg. Afghanistan sink deeper.

is that out? The keeper seems confident. Tossed up outside off, Cremer gets a lot of spin and drift, the ball deviates past the outside edge. Mirwais' foot is left outside, he doesn't bother dragging that foot back in and the keeper whips off the bails as he sees the foot outside the crease on the second attempt. Great bit of bowling but not very clever batting.

big swipe against the turn and another wicket. Slowed up on off, with lots of flight. Zadran's eyes lit up, saw an opportunity for some runs and went for an ugly hoick. A thick outside edge is easily snaffled up by Ervine at slip. Afghanistan are left reeling.

gone this time! taken at long-on, Jongwe. Cremer does get his five for. Nicely slowed up outside off, the batsmen goes for a swipe over long-on and connects nicely too, but does not quite get the desired elevation and was not helped by the fact that he was hitting against the turn. A good catch at the boundary
nicely tossed up outside off, Shenwari's eyes light up, he looks to slap that over cover but doesn't get the elevation, and Chigumbura accepts the catch gleefully. The slide continues

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Shahzad c Jongwe b Masakadza 5 (7b 1x4 0x6) SR: 71.42

dismissalComment.html: Shahzad goes! Exuberant stroke and he pays for it with his dismissal. Nothing delivery, full on middle with a  bit of air, Shahzad was not happy with just one boundary, he skipped down the track and heaved it away but straight down the throat of the deep midwicket fielder, picked him out to perfection.

headshotImage.caption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Nabi c Jongwe b Muzarabani 17 (18b 2x4 1x6) SR: 94.44

dismissalComment.html: short and wide, and taken! Against the run of play. Stunning catch from the third man fielder. Not a delivery you want to be getting out to, but Nabi played under the ball a touch and the ball bounced and took a thick outside edge which flew all the way to third man who dived and hung on to a sharp chance. Well done from Jongwe.

dismissalText.commentary: Nawroz Mangal c Chigumbura b Cremer 4 (9b 0x4 0x6) SR: 44.44

dismissalComment.html: gone! Another wild hoick and another wicket. Nice flight on middle, Mangal goes for a swipe over midwicket and against the turn, the ball turns a touch and takes the top edge which lobs up and straight to cover who takes an easy catch.

dismissalText.commentary: Asghar Afghan run out (Sikandar Raza) 9 (32b 0x4 0x6) SR: 28.12

dismissalComment.html: direct hit and that looks out. Amazing fielding from Raza. Shortish delivery outside off, chopped away towards cover. After some hesitation, Stanikzai decides to go for the run, Raza picks up cleanly and turns around, fires an accurate throw to the strikers end to find Stanikzai well short. Exceptional fielding.

headshotImage.longCaption: Noor Ali Zadran player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.longCaption: Noor Ali Zadran player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Noor Ali Zadran c Mutumbami b Chibhabha 63 (82b 8x4 0x6) SR: 76.82

dismissalComment.html: gone! Big wicket, the set man has to go. Just a full delivery outside off, Zadran looks to steer to third man but the ball skids on and takes a feather through to the keeper. Zadran looked really good in his innings but has to go now.

dismissalText.commentary: Samiullah Shinwari c Chigumbura b Sikandar Raza 3 (7b 0x4 0x6) SR: 42.85

dismissalComment.html: nicely tossed up outside off, Shenwari's eyes light up, he looks to slap that over cover but doesn't get the elevation, and Chigumbura accepts the catch gleefully. The slide continues

dismissalText.commentary: Najibullah Zadran c Ervine b Cremer 16 (32b 0x4 1x6) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: gone! The googly this time and Najibullah goes now, very poor delivery, pulls it short down leg but the googly generates some extra bounce and Najibullah goes back to pull but the bounce does for him, climbs sharply and takes the upper half of the bat. The ball spoons up for Ervine at short fine leg. Afghanistan sink deeper.

dismissalText.commentary: Mirwais Ashraf st Mutumbami b Cremer 3 (12b 0x4 0x6) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: is that out? The keeper seems confident. Tossed up outside off, Cremer gets a lot of spin and drift, the ball deviates past the outside edge. Mirwais' foot is left outside, he doesn't bother dragging that foot back in and the keeper whips off the bails as he sees the foot outside the crease on the second attempt. Great bit of bowling but not very clever batting.

dismissalText.commentary: Dawlat Zadran c Ervine b Cremer 1 (12b 0x4 0x6) SR: 8.33

dismissalComment.html: big swipe against the turn and another wicket. Slowed up on off, with lots of flight. Zadran's eyes lit up, saw an opportunity for some runs and went for an ugly hoick. A thick outside edge is easily snaffled up by Ervine at slip. Afghanistan are left reeling.

headshotImage.caption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalText.commentary: Yamin Ahmadzai c Jongwe b Cremer 0 (12b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: gone this time! taken at long-on, Jongwe. Cremer does get his five for. Nicely slowed up outside off, the batsmen goes for a swipe over long-on and connects nicely too, but does not quite get the desired elevation and was not helped by the fact that he was hitting against the turn. A good catch at the boundary

dismissalText.commentary: Elton Chigumbura b Mohammad Nabi 28 (41b 3x4 0x6) SR: 68.29

dismissalComment.html: Big, big wicket this. Tosses it up on middle, Chigumbura goes to whip to the leg side but misses completely. The ball sneaks through and hits the stumps. Nabi is ecstatic. The big wicket for Afghanistan there, the bowling change has worked.

dismissalText.commentary: Peter Moor b Amir Hamza 21 (50b 0x4 0x6) SR: 42

dismissalComment.html: beauty! Tossed up on middle and leg, the ball rips past the outside edge of Moor and clatters into off stump. Not much Moor could have done about that, a beautiful delivery, the right pace and flight.

bowled im. Poor shot selection. Flatter delivery from Hamza, drifts on with the arm and skids on but Chibhabha goes back and tries to cut a quick delivery, the ball hurries in and takes the pad and then clatters into off stump. Not a great shot at all, and Afghanistan sniff an opportunity.

beauty! Tossed up on middle and leg, the ball rips past the outside edge of Moor and clatters into off stump. Not much Moor could have done about that, a beautiful delivery, the right pace and flight.

headshotImage.caption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalComment.html: wow, beauty. Hamza does it again, goes wider of the crease and pitches on middle, that angle created made Jongwe defend down the line, but the ball spun and gripped in the wicket to take the off stump. Stunning delivery, and what a timely one at that. Zim now eight down, with lots of work to do.

gone! He has been given. Afghanistan win. What a performance from the bowlers. A slider on middle and leg, the ball skids on and hits TM on the pad in front of leg, the umpire had no hesitation and delirious scenes as Afghanistan go 1-0 up. Stumps are uprooted and fists are pumped, Zimbabwe are distraught.

Big, big wicket this. Tosses it up on middle, Chigumbura goes to whip to the leg side but misses completely. The ball sneaks through and hits the stumps. Nabi is ecstatic. The big wicket for Afghanistan there, the bowling change has worked.

ripper at short leg! Afghanistan are taking this home in style! Noor Ali, take a bow! Waller has been pressing forward to block, so Nabi held the ball back just enough that it would hit the pitch, kick off it and take the inside edge. The ball went low, but straight at the short leg fielder and Noor Ali dived forward to complete a lovely catch

headshotImage.caption: Wellington Masakadza player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Wellington Masakadza player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: gone! Zim nine down. Wellington goes for the sweep but the ball bounces a touch and takes the top edge. Spoons up for short fine leg to take. Zimbabwe have capitulated here.

dismissalText.commentary: Chamu Chibhabha b Amir Hamza 0 (1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: bowled im. Poor shot selection. Flatter delivery from Hamza, drifts on with the arm and skids on but Chibhabha goes back and tries to cut a quick delivery, the ball hurries in and takes the pad and then clatters into off stump. Not a great shot at all, and Afghanistan sniff an opportunity.

dismissalText.long: c Dawlat Zadran b Mirwais Ashraf
dismissalText.commentary: Craig Ervine c Dawlat Zadran b Mirwais Ashraf 6 (18b 1x4 0x6) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: Ervine goes! The pressure of dot balls has yielded another wicket. Ervine skips down and looks to swipe over midwicket but the ball takes a top edge and flies down to third man who takes an easy catch. Iffy strategy from the batsmen so far.

dismissalText.commentary: Richmond Mutumbami b Mirwais Ashraf 0 (2b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: bowled im, another one goes. Another wicket for Afghanistan and they are roaring back into the game here. Mutumbami plays from the crease and the ball ducks back in late and sneaks through a big gap between bat and pad before clattering into the stumps. Zimbabwe have lost three now

dismissalText.commentary: Peter Moor b Amir Hamza 21 (50b 0x4 0x6) SR: 42

dismissalComment.html: beauty! Tossed up on middle and leg, the ball rips past the outside edge of Moor and clatters into off stump. Not much Moor could have done about that, a beautiful delivery, the right pace and flight.

dismissalText.commentary: Elton Chigumbura b Mohammad Nabi 28 (41b 3x4 0x6) SR: 68.29

dismissalComment.html: Big, big wicket this. Tosses it up on middle, Chigumbura goes to whip to the leg side but misses completely. The ball sneaks through and hits the stumps. Nabi is ecstatic. The big wicket for Afghanistan there, the bowling change has worked.

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Sikandar Raza run out (Asghar Afghan/Mohammad Shahzad) 6 (25b 0x4 0x6) SR: 24

dismissalComment.html: gone. Raza has to go. A big wicket for Afghanistan, a total breakdown in communication. Raza drives towards mid-off with decent power and calls for a run immediately but Waller does't respond. Despite a fumble, the throw back is decent to the keeper and Zim lose another.

headshotImage.caption: Noor Ali Zadran player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Noor Ali Zadran player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Noor Ali Zadran b Mohammad Nabi
dismissalText.commentary: Malcolm Waller c Noor Ali Zadran b Mohammad Nabi 0 (5b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: ripper at short leg! Afghanistan are taking this home in style! Noor Ali, take a bow! Waller has been pressing forward to block, so Nabi held the ball back just enough that it would hit the pitch, kick off it and take the inside edge. The ball went low, but straight at the short leg fielder and Noor Ali dived forward to complete a lovely catch

headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalText.commentary: Luke Jongwe b Amir Hamza 4 (8b 0x4 0x6) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: wow, beauty. Hamza does it again, goes wider of the crease and pitches on middle, that angle created made Jongwe defend down the line, but the ball spun and gripped in the wicket to take the off stump. Stunning delivery, and what a timely one at that. Zim now eight down, with lots of work to do.

headshotImage.longCaption: Wellington Masakadza player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Wellington Masakadza c Yamin Ahmadzai b Mohammad Nabi 0 (6b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: gone! Zim nine down. Wellington goes for the sweep but the ball bounces a touch and takes the top edge. Spoons up for short fine leg to take. Zimbabwe have capitulated here.

dismissalText.commentary: Taurai Muzarabani lbw b Amir Hamza 2 (8b 0x4 0x6) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: gone! He has been given. Afghanistan win. What a performance from the bowlers. A slider on middle and leg, the ball skids on and hits TM on the pad in front of leg, the umpire had no hesitation and delirious scenes as Afghanistan go 1-0 up. Stumps are uprooted and fists are pumped, Zimbabwe are distraught.

headshotImage.caption: Noor Ali Zadran player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Noor Ali Zadran player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Taurai Muzarabani lbw b Amir Hamza 2 (8b 0x4 0x6) SR: 25

commentTextItems.html: gone! He has been given. Afghanistan win. What a performance from the bowlers. A slider on middle and leg, the ball skids on and hits TM on the pad in front of leg, the umpire had no hesitation and delirious scenes as Afghanistan go 1-0 up. Stumps are uprooted and fists are pumped, Zimbabwe are distraught.

commentPostTextItems.html: 8.40pm Wow, what a sensational comeback that has been from Afghanistan. Who'd have thunk? Their bowlers have dominated and put on a show for a global audience on Christmas Day. Defending 131, early wickets were a must and they picked em up before the dinner break. Amir Hamza took one in his first over and Ashraf took two in an over to keep this game interesting. however, thee post-dinner period was thoroughly dominated by Hamza and Nabi who ran through the middle order in spectacular fashion. Absolutely delirious scenes among the Afghanistan players and staff and why not? Zimbabwe were poor, they had no answers to spin and got themselves in a hole, just like the Afghanistan batsmen. Chigumbura looked in control during his innings but things fell away following his dismissal.

Amir Hamza is the Man of the Match: "The captain told me 'to bowl wicket to wicket and if an opportunity is there, don't miss out'. Inzy and Prabhakar also told me not to miss an opportunity. We have been here for a week, we have trained. We have a strong domestic structure which gets better day by day.

Asghar Stanikzai: "A low-scoring match and of course we are very happy. Wicket is very good for spin, spinners had to support the bowler. We know this wicket. Very good game for Noor. Some poor shots and we have to improve.

Elton Chigumbura: "I thought we started well, at one stage we thought they would score 270. Cremer and Wellington bowled well, disappointing with the bat. Me and Moor got in, we are the ones who lost this game, we didn't take it home. We have to polish our mistakes. It's not about the toss, its about how you play the spinners if you play them well you are bound to win the game. We have 2-3 days to ensure we polish our mistakes today."

commentTextItems.html: fired full and quick on leg, TM shuffles across and miss his flick, very very close to leg stump there.
full and flat on off, dug out
slowed up and wide outside off, TM guides one down on the bounce to first slip

commentPreTextItems.html: PrashanthLV: "Counterattacking is a risk, stay rock solid at the crease till last 5 overs, runs will come on its own. "

commentTextItems.html: flighted on off, TM goes to the pitch to block
Cremer goes for the run, slower outside off, played towards short third man where a run is completed
tossed up down leg, may have clipped the pad on the way to the keeper. Shahzad goes up immediately but rightly not given.
a touch too short on leg, clipped to deep square leg

commentPreTextItems.html: What a resounding performance this has been from the bowlers, but the job isn't over yet. Here is last man Muzarabani. Nabi and Stanikzai have a chat.

commentTextItems.html: flatter outside off, off the outside half towards short third man for one

commentPostTextItems.html: Zakir: "From here onward it seems very difficult but not impossible for Zim although its very close to victory for Afghanistan."

dismissalText.long: c Yamin Ahmadzai b Mohammad Nabi
dismissalText.commentary: Wellington Masakadza c Yamin Ahmadzai b Mohammad Nabi 0 (6b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

commentPreTextItems.html: The fielders surround the batsman. A slip and silly point

commentTextItems.html: gone! Zim nine down. Wellington goes for the sweep but the ball bounces a touch and takes the top edge. Spoons up for short fine leg to take. Zimbabwe have capitulated here.
slower on middle and leg, worked away towards backward square leg
big appeal, not given! Good decision, slid on with the arm and beat the outside edge outside off

headshotImage.caption: Wellington Masakadza player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Wellington Masakadza player page headshot cutout, 2021

commentTextItems.html: pushed wider of the crease, the ball spins a mile but Wellington follows the ball and turns to square leg
quicker but straight, Wellington gets some bat on his block
slower outside off, driven to cover

commentPreTextItems.html: 54 to win for Zim but only two wickets in hand, either  a partnership or a counterattacking cameo is a must at this point for Zim. Afghanistan are all over the batsmen.

commentTextItems.html: premeditated sweep. Slower offspinner outside off, the batsman goes across and tries to sweep but the ball is pulled back, an awkward paddle ensues

dismissalText.commentary: Luke Jongwe b Amir Hamza 4 (8b 0x4 0x6) SR: 50

commentTextItems.html: wow, beauty. Hamza does it again, goes wider of the crease and pitches on middle, that angle created made Jongwe defend down the line, but the ball spun and gripped in the wicket to take the off stump. Stunning delivery, and what a timely one at that. Zim now eight down, with lots of work to do.
runs! Important runs! Nabi drops one short and on leg too. Cremer goes back quickly and pummels a pull to backward square leg

headshotImage.caption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

commentTextItems.html: floated up on middle and leg, blocked
punched back to the bowler

Nothing delivery, full on middle with a  bit of air, Shahzad was not happy with just one boundary, he skipped down the track and heaved it away but straight down the throat of the deep midwicket fielder, picked him out to perfection.

gone! Another wild hoick and another wicket. Nice flight on middle, Mangal goes for a swipe over midwicket and against the turn, the ball turns a touch and takes the top edge which lobs up and straight to cover who takes an easy catch.

gone! The googly this time and Najibullah goes now, very poor delivery, pulls it short down leg but the googly generates some extra bounce and Najibullah goes back to pull but the bounce does for him, climbs sharply and takes the upper half of the bat. The ball spoons up for Ervine at short fine leg. Afghanistan sink deeper.

is that out? The keeper seems confident. Tossed up outside off, Cremer gets a lot of spin and drift, the ball deviates past the outside edge. Mirwais' foot is left outside, he doesn't bother dragging that foot back in and the keeper whips off the bails as he sees the foot outside the crease on the second attempt. Great bit of bowling but not very clever batting.

big swipe against the turn and another wicket. Slowed up on off, with lots of flight. Zadran's eyes lit up, saw an opportunity for some runs and went for an ugly hoick. A thick outside edge is easily snaffled up by Ervine at slip. Afghanistan are left reeling.

gone this time! taken at long-on, Jongwe. Cremer does get his five for. Nicely slowed up outside off, the batsmen goes for a swipe over long-on and connects nicely too, but does not quite get the desired elevation and was not helped by the fact that he was hitting against the turn. A good catch at the boundary
nicely tossed up outside off, Shenwari's eyes light up, he looks to slap that over cover but doesn't get the elevation, and Chigumbura accepts the catch gleefully. The slide continues

headshotImage.caption: Noor Ali Zadran player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Noor Ali Zadran player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: gone! Big wicket, the set man has to go. Just a full delivery outside off, Zadran looks to steer to third man but the ball skids on and takes a feather through to the keeper. Zadran looked really good in his innings but has to go now.

headshotImage.longCaption: Wellington Masakadza player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Shahzad c Jongwe b Masakadza 5 (7b 1x4 0x6) SR: 71.42

dismissalComment.html: Shahzad goes! Exuberant stroke and he pays for it with his dismissal. Nothing delivery, full on middle with a  bit of air, Shahzad was not happy with just one boundary, he skipped down the track and heaved it away but straight down the throat of the deep midwicket fielder, picked him out to perfection.

headshotImage.caption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalText.commentary: Mohammad Nabi c Jongwe b Muzarabani 17 (18b 2x4 1x6) SR: 94.44

dismissalComment.html: short and wide, and taken! Against the run of play. Stunning catch from the third man fielder. Not a delivery you want to be getting out to, but Nabi played under the ball a touch and the ball bounced and took a thick outside edge which flew all the way to third man who dived and hung on to a sharp chance. Well done from Jongwe.

dismissalText.commentary: Nawroz Mangal c Chigumbura b Cremer 4 (9b 0x4 0x6) SR: 44.44

dismissalComment.html: gone! Another wild hoick and another wicket. Nice flight on middle, Mangal goes for a swipe over midwicket and against the turn, the ball turns a touch and takes the top edge which lobs up and straight to cover who takes an easy catch.

dismissalText.commentary: Asghar Afghan run out (Sikandar Raza) 9 (32b 0x4 0x6) SR: 28.12

dismissalComment.html: direct hit and that looks out. Amazing fielding from Raza. Shortish delivery outside off, chopped away towards cover. After some hesitation, Stanikzai decides to go for the run, Raza picks up cleanly and turns around, fires an accurate throw to the strikers end to find Stanikzai well short. Exceptional fielding.

headshotImage.caption: Noor Ali Zadran player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Noor Ali Zadran player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Noor Ali Zadran player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Noor Ali Zadran player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Noor Ali Zadran c Mutumbami b Chibhabha 63 (82b 8x4 0x6) SR: 76.82

dismissalComment.html: gone! Big wicket, the set man has to go. Just a full delivery outside off, Zadran looks to steer to third man but the ball skids on and takes a feather through to the keeper. Zadran looked really good in his innings but has to go now.

dismissalText.commentary: Samiullah Shinwari c Chigumbura b Sikandar Raza 3 (7b 0x4 0x6) SR: 42.85

dismissalComment.html: nicely tossed up outside off, Shenwari's eyes light up, he looks to slap that over cover but doesn't get the elevation, and Chigumbura accepts the catch gleefully. The slide continues

dismissalText.commentary: Najibullah Zadran c Ervine b Cremer 16 (32b 0x4 1x6) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: gone! The googly this time and Najibullah goes now, very poor delivery, pulls it short down leg but the googly generates some extra bounce and Najibullah goes back to pull but the bounce does for him, climbs sharply and takes the upper half of the bat. The ball spoons up for Ervine at short fine leg. Afghanistan sink deeper.

dismissalText.commentary: Mirwais Ashraf st Mutumbami b Cremer 3 (12b 0x4 0x6) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: is that out? The keeper seems confident. Tossed up outside off, Cremer gets a lot of spin and drift, the ball deviates past the outside edge. Mirwais' foot is left outside, he doesn't bother dragging that foot back in and the keeper whips off the bails as he sees the foot outside the crease on the second attempt. Great bit of bowling but not very clever batting.

dismissalText.commentary: Dawlat Zadran c Ervine b Cremer 1 (12b 0x4 0x6) SR: 8.33

dismissalComment.html: big swipe against the turn and another wicket. Slowed up on off, with lots of flight. Zadran's eyes lit up, saw an opportunity for some runs and went for an ugly hoick. A thick outside edge is easily snaffled up by Ervine at slip. Afghanistan are left reeling.

headshotImage.caption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalText.commentary: Yamin Ahmadzai c Jongwe b Cremer 0 (12b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: gone this time! taken at long-on, Jongwe. Cremer does get his five for. Nicely slowed up outside off, the batsmen goes for a swipe over long-on and connects nicely too, but does not quite get the desired elevation and was not helped by the fact that he was hitting against the turn. A good catch at the boundary

dismissalText.commentary: Peter Moor b Amir Hamza 21 (50b 0x4 0x6) SR: 42

dismissalComment.html: beauty! Tossed up on middle and leg, the ball rips past the outside edge of Moor and clatters into off stump. Not much Moor could have done about that, a beautiful delivery, the right pace and flight.

dismissalText.commentary: Chamu Chibhabha b Amir Hamza 0 (1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: bowled im. Poor shot selection. Flatter delivery from Hamza, drifts on with the arm and skids on but Chibhabha goes back and tries to cut a quick delivery, the ball hurries in and takes the pad and then clatters into off stump. Not a great shot at all, and Afghanistan sniff an opportunity.

dismissalText.long: c Dawlat Zadran b Mirwais Ashraf
dismissalText.commentary: Craig Ervine c Dawlat Zadran b Mirwais Ashraf 6 (18b 1x4 0x6) SR: 33.33

dismissalComment.html: Ervine goes! The pressure of dot balls has yielded another wicket. Ervine skips down and looks to swipe over midwicket but the ball takes a top edge and flies down to third man who takes an easy catch. Iffy strategy from the batsmen so far.

dismissalText.commentary: Richmond Mutumbami b Mirwais Ashraf 0 (2b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: bowled im, another one goes. Another wicket for Afghanistan and they are roaring back into the game here. Mutumbami plays from the crease and the ball ducks back in late and sneaks through a big gap between bat and pad before clattering into the stumps. Zimbabwe have lost three now

dismissalText.commentary: Elton Chigumbura b Mohammad Nabi 28 (41b 3x4 0x6) SR: 68.29

dismissalComment.html: Big, big wicket this. Tosses it up on middle, Chigumbura goes to whip to the leg side but misses completely. The ball sneaks through and hits the stumps. Nabi is ecstatic. The big wicket for Afghanistan there, the bowling change has worked.

headshotImage.caption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Mohammad Shahzad player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Sikandar Raza run out (Asghar Afghan/Mohammad Shahzad) 6 (25b 0x4 0x6) SR: 24

dismissalComment.html: gone. Raza has to go. A big wicket for Afghanistan, a total breakdown in communication. Raza drives towards mid-off with decent power and calls for a run immediately but Waller does't respond. Despite a fumble, the throw back is decent to the keeper and Zim lose another.

headshotImage.caption: Noor Ali Zadran player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Noor Ali Zadran player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Noor Ali Zadran b Mohammad Nabi
dismissalText.commentary: Malcolm Waller c Noor Ali Zadran b Mohammad Nabi 0 (5b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: ripper at short leg! Afghanistan are taking this home in style! Noor Ali, take a bow! Waller has been pressing forward to block, so Nabi held the ball back just enough that it would hit the pitch, kick off it and take the inside edge. The ball went low, but straight at the short leg fielder and Noor Ali dived forward to complete a lovely catch

headshotImage.caption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

headshotImage.caption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022
headshotImage.longCaption: Luke Jongwe, player page headshot cutout 2022

dismissalText.commentary: Luke Jongwe b Amir Hamza 4 (8b 0x4 0x6) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: wow, beauty. Hamza does it again, goes wider of the crease and pitches on middle, that angle created made Jongwe defend down the line, but the ball spun and gripped in the wicket to take the off stump. Stunning delivery, and what a timely one at that. Zim now eight down, with lots of work to do.

dismissalText.commentary: Graeme Cremer not out 12 (22b 1x4 0x6) SR: 54.54

headshotImage.caption: Wellington Masakadza player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Wellington Masakadza player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Wellington Masakadza player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Wellington Masakadza player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.long: c Yamin Ahmadzai b Mohammad Nabi
dismissalText.commentary: Wellington Masakadza c Yamin Ahmadzai b Mohammad Nabi 0 (6b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: gone! Zim nine down. Wellington goes for the sweep but the ball bounces a touch and takes the top edge. Spoons up for short fine leg to take. Zimbabwe have capitulated here.

dismissalText.commentary: Taurai Muzarabani lbw b Amir Hamza 2 (8b 0x4 0x6) SR: 25

dismissalComment.html: gone! He has been given. Afghanistan win. What a performance from the bowlers. A slider on middle and leg, the ball skids on and hits TM on the pad in front of leg, the umpire had no hesitation and delirious scenes as Afghanistan go 1-0 up. Stumps are uprooted and fists are pumped, Zimbabwe are distraught.

bowled im. Poor shot selection. Flatter delivery from Hamza, drifts on with the arm and skids on but Chibhabha goes back and tries to cut a quick delivery, the ball hurries in and takes the pad and then clatters into off stump. Not a great shot at all, and Afghanistan sniff an opportunity.

notes: Afghanistan: 50 runs in 9.1 overs (55 balls), Extras 1
Drinks: Afghanistan - 78/3 in 18.0 overs (Noor Ali Zadran 48, Asghar Stanikzai 3)
Noor Ali Zadran: 50 off 64 balls (7 x 4)
Afghanistan: 100 runs in 23.3 overs (141 balls), Extras 5
Innings Break: Afghanistan - 131/10 in 38.5 overs (Amir Hamza 2)
Dinner: Zimbabwe - 28/3 in 11.0 overs (PJ Moor 11, E Chigumbura 10)
Zimbabwe: 50 runs in 17.1 overs (104 balls), Extras 3

milestones.description: This is the lowest match aggregate (213) involving teams Zimbabwe & Afghanistan in ODIs
Dawlat Zadran has broken the record for most ducks (4) in ODIs for AFG, going past Nawroz Mangal's 4

stories.title: Afghanistan v Zimbabwe in the UAE, 2015-16
stories.subTitle: 1st ODI, Sharjah
stories.seoTitle: Wisden Almanack review: Afghanistan v Zimbabwe in the UAE, 2015-16
stories.summary: Wisden's review of the first ODI, Afghanistan v Zimbabwe in the UAE, 2015-16

stories.title: Hamza, Nabi help Afghanistan defend 131
stories.subTitle: Afghanistan v Zimbabwe, 1st ODI, Sharjah
stories.summary: Two halves of contrasting nature brought out all the elements associated with a low-scoring thriller, which Afghanistan clinched by 49 runs as Zimbabwe slumped to 82 all out in Sharjah

image.caption: Mohammad Nabi and Noor Ali Zadran added 97 for the second wicket
image.longCaption: Mohammad Nabi and Noor Ali Zadran added 97 for the second wicket, Zimbabwe v Afghanistan, 5th ODI, Bulawayo, October 24, 2015

stories.title: Zimbabwe seek solution to batting woes
stories.subTitle: Afghanistan v Zimbabwe, 1st ODI, Sharjah
stories.seoTitle: Zimbabwe seek solution to batting woes
stories.summary: While Afghanistan will be eager to finish 2015 on a high, Zimbabwe will have to resolve their batting issues to turn their fortunes around in the five ODIs starting Friday in Sharjah
